metadata.dc:author: Vadell, E M
metadata.dc:description: Five taxa of dictyostelid cellular slime molds were isolated from soil and litter samples of the relictual gallery forest of Punta Lara (34 degrees 47' S, 58 degrees 1' W), Province of Buenos Aires, Argentina. Dictyostelium lavandulum, D. polycephalum, D. purpureum and Polysphondylium violaceum were identified from most samples studied, whereas D. macrocephalum was isolated only once. Strains were lyophilized and kept in the BAFC Ceparium. Two additional isolated strains were related to D. sphaerocephalum, and to D. mucoroides var. stoloniferum. These species were likewise found, among others, in soils of the Iguazú National Park (Misiones, Argentina) in 1995.
metadata.dc:title: Dictiostélidos (Eumycetozoa) de suelos de Punta Lara, Provincia de Buenos Aires, Argentina.
[Dictyostelids (Eumycetozoa) from soils of Punta Lara, Province of Buenos Aires, Argentina].
